title: Get started
code: library(spectralem)  data <- synthetic.signal(seed = 1, K = 30, noise = 0.005) x <- data$x y <- data$y  res <- spectralem(x, y, K = 30, print_progress = FALSE) # no progress bar for vignettes  # get position of fitted peaks res$fit_params$pos #>  [1] 670.9707 503.2656 300.2834 274.9292 801.6447 251.4052 706.4714 411.1247 #>  [9] 770.3988 354.3531 187.4783 550.1228 326.5966 313.7704 854.5285 726.4122 #> [17] 772.4744 572.6367 688.3358 502.0227 516.6996 203.3263 809.3393 252.8646 #> [25] 238.9032 305.9471 549.7953 188.2852 180.1685 314.6850  fit <- voigt.model(x, res$fit_params) # or alternatively fit <- res$fit  # plot the fit using a helper function defined in the appendix plot_helper(x, y, fit)

title: Get started
code: data <- synthetic.signal(1212, 4, 0.001)  res <- spectralem(   data$x, data$y,   K = 4,   start_peaks = list(     pos = c(465, 644, 828, 862),     gwidth = c(5, 5, 5, 5),     lwidth = c(0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1)   ),   print_progress = FALSE # no progress bar for vignettes )  # plot the fit plot_helper(data$x, data$y, res$fit)

what: Using BSplines as a Background Model
title: Get started
text: Using ‘background_model’ fixed background signal can added. advised set ‘linear = FALSE’.
code: data <- synthetic.signal(seed = 312, K = 4, noise = 0.005) x <- data$x y <- data$y  # add spline background to data library(splines2) bsMat <- bSpline(x, df = 3) f1 <- c(bsMat[, 1]) f2 <- c(bsMat[, 2]) f3 <- c(bsMat[, 3]) y <- y + 0.4 * f1 + 0.04 * f2 + 0.2 * f3  # fit res <- spectralem(x, y, K = 4,                   background_model = list(linear = TRUE, f1, f2, f3), print_progress = FALSE)  # voigt.model does not support non linear background; add them manually alpha <- res$fit_params$background_amps fit <- voigt.model(x, res$fit_params) + f1 * alpha[1] + f2 * alpha[2] + f3 * alpha[3] # or alternatively fit <- res$fit  # plot the fit plot_helper(x, y, res$fit)

title: Get started
code: # helper function for plotting plot_helper <- function(x, y, fit){   library(ggplot2)   pd <- data.frame(x = x, y = y, fit = fit)   ggplot(pd, aes(x)) +     geom_line(aes(y = y, colour = "y")) +     geom_line(aes(y = fit, colour = "fit")) +     theme_bw() }

what: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
title: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
text: Implements algorithm discussed <paperedoi>. model fitted defined : $$f(x) = x + b + \sum_{j=1}^K \beta_j V(x \mid \theta_j) + \sum_{=1} \alpha_i f_i(x)$$ \(\beta_j > 0\) amplitudes Voigt profiles \(V\) \(\theta_j\) represents position (pos), Gaussian (gwidth) Lorentzian (lwidth) width Voigt profile. requires starting parameters, optionally can passed start_peaks. impactful hyperparameters typical_width add_component_every_iters. former bit smaller typical width Voigt profiles signal. chosen big small fit usually suboptimal. hyperparameter add_component_every_iters defines number iterations perform new peak added. Setting bigger value comes greater computational cost usually results better fit. hyperparameter max_iter defines total number iterations, impact similar usually weaker add_component_every_iters. Additionally, possible fit arbitrary positive background functions \(f_i(x) > 0\), default zero. Note \(\alpha_i > 0\) must hold. BSplines used . Implementation uses Voigt profiles defined 'RcppFaddeeva::Voigt()'.

title: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
code: spectralem(   x,   y,   K,   start_peaks = list(pos = c(), gwidth = c(), lwidth = c()),   background_model = list(linear = TRUE),   typical_width = diff(range(x))/100/2,   add_component_every_iters = 10,   max_iter = add_component_every_iters * (K + 2 + ceiling(K/2)),   min_width = 1e-06 * mean(diff(x)),   possible_peak_positions = range(x),   print_progress = TRUE )

title: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
text: x x coordinates signal y function values function fit evaluated x coordinates K number peaks fit start_peaks optional initial peak parameters; list see examples background_model defines background model typical_width typical width voigt profile signal add_component_every_iters number iterations perform new peak added max_iter maximal number iterations min_width minimal gaussian lorentzian width possible_peak_positions allowed range positions fitted peaks, can increased fit cut peaks print_progress whether print progress bar

title: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
text: list components: fit_params - list contains named components amp, pos, gwidth lwidth vectors length.                      -th entry yields parameters -th Voigt profile.                      named components list b describe slope offset linear background respectively.                      \(f_i(x)\) specified also contains vector background_amps representing \(\alpha_i\) fit - vector containing function values fitted function evaluated x.

title: Robust, fast and fully automated peak fitting of Voigt profiles to spectral data — spectralem
code: if (FALSE) { res <- spectralem(   x, y,   K = 4, )  res <- spectralem(   x, y,   K = 4,   start_peaks = list(     pos = c(332, 577, 697),     gwidth = c(5, 5, 5),     lwidth = c(0.1, 0.1, 0.1)   ) )  res <- spectralem(   x, y,   K = 4,   background_model = list(linear = TRUE, f1, f2, f3) ) }

what: Signal model for Voigt profiles — voigt.model
title: Signal model for Voigt profiles — voigt.model
text: Implements signal model discussed `spectralem()`. include \(f_i\). Parameters passed list params components amp, pos, gwidth lwidth vectors length. -th entry yields parameters -th Voigt profile. Furthermore named components b describe slope offset linear background respectively. See examples.
